update.description: This is a work in progress porting the `gazebo_motor_model` from rotors_simulator to an ignition gazebo system. I've started by duplicating and renaming the `ApplyJointForce` system (e77f0b1) and copying the [UpdateForcesAndMoments()](https://github.com/ethz-asl/rotors_simulator/blob/master/rotors_gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_motor_model.cpp#L390) function into it (ed4c807), and trying to port pieces over so that it will compile (various commits). Once it compiles, I will work on connecting the publishers and subscribers.
update.title: [Blueprint] Multicopter motor model

content.raw: CI is green. I'm merging.
content.html: CI is green. I'm merging.

content.raw: LGTM. Seems to work pretty well in my testing.
content.html: LGTM. Seems to work pretty well in my testing.

content.raw: I think `ref_motor_input_` needs a mutex. It's not clear to me whether a double can be safely used by multiple threads without synchronization.
content.html: I think ref_motor_input_ needs a mutex. It's not clear to me whether a double can be safely used by multiple threads without synchronization.

content.raw:
That seems fine for the gazebo codebase. 

Ignition launch supports adding plugins to models without modifying the model SDF. Example at #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch/src/4f28c12b1c09a7447c1eddf0e053e82682e1f5b3/examples/gazebo_plugins.ign#lines-55. Subt users will use this approach.
content.html:
That seems fine for the gazebo codebase.

Ignition launch supports adding plugins to models without modifying the model SDF. Example at #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch/src/4f28c12b1c09a7447c1eddf0e053e82682e1f5b3/examples/gazebo_plugins.ign#lines-55. Subt users will use this approach.
a8469d0d8668

content.raw: yes, I looked at [bool Element::Get(const std::string&, T &, const T &)](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/08ea83caa185e305fcc5d21b80e0b388cf9901b0/include/sdf/Element.hh#lines-256:265), but I didn't use it because the rotors version has a console message if the `_verbose` flag is set and the default parameter is used. However, I just noticed that `_verbose` is always false in the getSdfParam function calls, so I'll switch to `Element::Get` as you suggest.
content.html: yes, I looked at bool Element::Get(const std::string&, T &, const T &), but I didn't use it because the rotors version has a console message if the _verbose flag is set and the default parameter is used. However, I just noticed that _verbose is always false in the getSdfParam function calls, so I'll switch to Element::Get as you suggest.

content.raw:
I looked into this a bit yesterday and had myself convinced that `q.RotateVector(v)` was equivalent to `q * v`:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/commits/c06a2d4eb9a8612cfb618b3eb119cae4aca887a5

but you have done more testing of this controller than me, so I defer
content.html:
I looked into this a bit yesterday and had myself convinced that q.RotateVector(v) was equivalent to q * v:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/commits/c06a2d4eb9a8612cfb618b3eb119cae4aca887a5

but you have done more testing of this controller than me, so I defer
e966779

content.raw: applied in f7daadd
content.html: applied in f7daadd

content.raw: Changed in e966779. `Rot()` returns a quaternion so the `*` operator is a quaternion-vector product not a rotation.
content.html: Changed in e966779. Rot() returns a quaternion so the * operator is a quaternion-vector product not a rotation.

content.raw: If components like `JointVelocity` have just been created, Physics would not have had the chance to update them yet.  We should probably skip calling `UpdateForcesAndMoments` if that's the case.
content.html: If components like JointVelocity have just been created, Physics would not have had the chance to update them yet. We should probably skip calling UpdateForcesAndMoments if that's the case.

content.raw: this is now ready for review
content.html: this is now ready for review

content.raw:
I removed the publisher that sends equal commands to all motors, so you have to publish a message now on the debug branch to see the thing fly:

~~~
# to go up
$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
velocity: 700 
velocity: 700
velocity: 700
velocity: 700'
~~~

~~~
# to go down
$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
velocity: 0 
velocity: 0
velocity: 0
velocity: 0'
~~~
content.html:
I removed the publisher that sends equal commands to all motors, so you have to publish a message now on the debug branch to see the thing fly:

# to go up
$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
velocity: 700 
velocity: 700
velocity: 700
velocity: 700'

# to go down
$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
velocity: 0 
velocity: 0
velocity: 0
velocity: 0'
